content:
Some suspect the hand of Joseph Kabila

For a while it looked as if the Democratic Republic of Congo might actually hold an election on December 23rd. Photos of electronic voting machines being shipped by boat and bicycle to remote polling stations spread though social media. The electoral commission held press conferences where it insisted that it was ready. Joseph Kabila, the president, promised that the elections would be “perfect”.

But on December 13th a warehouse in Kinshasa (the country’s rambling capital) went up in flames and some 8,000 voting machines were destroyed. Opposition politicians were quick to blame Mr Kabila for sabotaging the elections. He has been in power since his father was shot in 2001 and should have stepped down when his term ended two years ago. Mr Kabila’s people, in turn, blamed their opponents, many of whom have been loudly critical of the plan to use voting machines instead of pens and paper ballots, arguing that it will allow the government to rig the poll.

The head of the electoral commission, Corneille Nangaa, coolly announced that there were plenty of spare machines and the fire would not stop elections from happening on the 23rd. Then he backtracked, postponing the vote until December 30th. Mr Nangaa blamed “the material deficit” caused by the fire and implored the country to stay calm.

Yet Congo’s 80m people are getting a little impatient. Although the country has vast mineral wealth, more than 70% of its people survive on less than $1.90 a day. For more than five decades it has been misruled by a string of kleptocrats, Mr Kabila junior included. More than 100 rebel militias operate around the country, and a jihadist group is terrorising an area in the east where an Ebola outbreak is also raging.

In 2016, after the conclusion of his constitutional term, Mr Kabila simply decided not to leave power and brutally suppressed protests calling for him to do so. He only relented and promised an election after being put under international pressure. But he picked a former interior minister, Emmanuel Ramazani Shadary, as his successor. Many think that he still hopes to rule from the shadows.

Mr Shadary, who faces a fatally fractured opposition, may well win if the vote does indeed take place. Although he lags behind other candidates in popularity polls, Mr Kabila’s backing means everything. His campaign rallies have gone a lot more smoothly than those for an opposition candidate, Martin Fayulu. When Mr Fayulu visited the city of Lubumbashi, two of his supporters were shot by the police and 43 people were injured. On the day he planned to hold a rally in Kinshasa, the government banned campaigning over security concerns. His backers were dispersed with tear gas.

The election postponement may spark protests that could quickly turn bloody. The country’s Catholic clergymen (who have long headed a campaign for free and fair elections) will be praying that the electoral commission gets its act together by next Sunday. As should anyone who cares about Congo.

ex: n. 伊波拉病毒；埃博拉病毒

eg2: We await your command.
我们等待你的口令。
We await your decision.; We are expecting you to make a decision.

If the changes that  delivery are independent of other changes, the changes can be delivered directly.
如果等待交付的变更对其他的变更来说是独立的，那么该变更可以直接进行交付。

ex: vi. [计] 回溯；由原路返回；放弃
vt. 追踪；循迹调查
eg2: We backtrack to here again.
我们再次回溯到这儿。
We backtrack to here.
我们回溯到这儿。
On the premise that other researchers and authors who find "Elephants" useful may also be useful to me, I have a way to backtrack the influence of ideas.
假定认为“大象”对其有益的学者和作者们的文章可能对我来说也是有益的，我就有办法回溯这些思想的影响。

wp.preferential ballot: 选择选举制的选票;偏好投票制

ex: n. 投票；投票用纸；投票总数
vi. 投票；抽签决定
vt. 使投票表决；拉选票
n. (Ballot)人名；(英)巴洛特；(法)巴洛
eg2: He has tallied the result of the .
他已经将投票结果记录下来了。
If people paid taxes, then they should be able to vote, since only through the ballot could they prevent the government from abusing its powers and depriving them of their liberty.
如果人们纳税，那么他们就应该能够投票，只有通过投票才能防止政府滥用权力和剥夺人们的自由。
To deny anyone or any group the ballot lessens its importance, for the individual and for the community.
否认任何人或任何群体的投票权，就是降低了选举对个人和社会的重要意义。

ex: adv. 残忍地；野蛮地；兽性地
eg2: The Serbs brutally murdered many of the men.
塞尔维亚人残忍地谋杀了许多人。
I was brutally tortured to the point of them entering weapons inside me.
我遭受了野蛮的折磨，他们把武器弄进我身体里。
I'd wrench them off her fingers, if they ever menaced me,' he answered , when the door had closed after her.
“如果这些一旦威胁到我头上，我就要把它们从手指头上拔掉，”当她跑掉后门关上时，他野蛮地回答。

ex: n. 赤字；不足额
eg2: And so -- but we do have to deal with the .
所以说——但是，我们的确必须解决赤字问题。
They must retrench their expenditure for the purpose of making up the .

But how do you show seriousness about the budget deficit amid that spending?

ex: n. 火焰；激情；火舌；鲜红色
v. 燃烧；使变红；发送火药味电邮（或互联网信息）
网络 热情；光辉；光芒
eg2: the tiny yellow flame of a match
火柴小小的黄色火焰
The flames were growing higher and higher.
熊熊火焰越来越高。
The building was in flames(= was burning) .
大楼失火了。
The plane burst into flame(s)(= suddenly began burning strongly) .
飞机突然起了大火。
Everything went up in flames(= was destroyed by fire) .
一切都毁于大火。
a flame-red car
橘红色的汽车
a flame of passion
激情的烈火
The logs flamed on the hearth.
木柴在壁炉炉床里燃烧。
Hope flamed in her.
她满怀希望。
Her cheeks flamed with rage.
她愤怒得两颊通红。

ex: n. 断裂；裂缝；【医学】挫伤；【矿物】断口
v. (使)破裂；(使)折断；(使)断裂；使破坏

eg2: a fracture of the leg/skull
腿骨╱颅骨骨折
a compound/simple fracture(= one in which the broken bone comes/does not come through the skin)
复合（开放）骨折；单纯（闭合）骨折
Old people's bones are more prone to fracture.
老人更易骨折。
His leg fractured in two places.
他的一条腿有两处骨折。
She fell and fractured her skull.
她跌倒摔裂了颅骨。
a fractured pipeline
破裂的管道
Many people predicted that the party would fracture and split.
很多人预言该党将分崩离析。
The company was fractured into several smaller groups.
这家公司被拆分成几家小公司。

ex: adj. 焦躁的；不耐心的
eg2: Why are you always so short and ?
你为什么是这么暴和没有耐心？
Have you been over reacting? Have you been ?
你有没有过过度反应，你有没有过急躁不安？
Were you so convinced that you were right and just  to prove it?
你是否真的那么相信自己是正确的并且急着要证明它？

ex: vt. 恳求或乞求
vi. 恳求或乞求
eg2: If you missed that post, I implore you to go back and look at the comments.
如果你错过了那篇文章，我恳请你移步看看那些评论。
During this season of giving, I implore our online readers to reach out to those who are struggling and help ensure that children are fed.
在这样一个感恩有季节，我恳求我们的在线读者们，走出去，帮帮那些处在困境当中的人们，确保孩子们能够吃饱穿暖。
As he was the first to injure, make him the first to  pardon; and then--why then, Ellen, I might show you some generosity.
既然是他先伤害我的，就叫他先求饶；然后——到那时候呀，艾伦，我也许可以向你表现出一点宽宏大量来。

作为一个晚辈，我们应该尊敬老人。
If the boss is in the office there is pressure for  employees to stay. Despite the hours, I doubt the Japanese are more productive.
如果老板在办公室，下级员工就会有留下来的压力。尽管人们超时工作，但我怀疑日本人是否有更多的产出。

vi. 爆发
eg2: The cholera outbreak has been contained.
霍乱的爆发已被遏制住。
Such events may forecast an outbreak of war.
这些事件可能预示着战争的爆发。
However, even in the early days of the , not everyone with swine flu will have visited their GP.
然而，即使是在爆发早期，也做不到每一个猪流感病人都能拜访他们的家庭医生。

ex: vt. 使…延期；把…放在次要地位；把…放在后面
vi. 延缓，延迟；延缓发作
eg2: Do not avoid or postpone tasks and activities.
不要回避或者延缓任务或者活动。
Lacking money, they had to  their plan.
没有钱，他们只得推迟计划。
If [a needed feature] is a few months out, you can postpone your procurement to the next generation.
“如果需要的特性已经过时几个月了，你可以把你的购买推迟到下一代产品”。

ex: n. 延期；延缓
eg2: He compounded with his creditors for a  of payment.
他与债权人达成协议延期付款。
At least the conference’s  is susceptible of an innocent explanation. Months of torrential rain have caused flooding and landslides all over the country.
至少对这次会议的延期，朝鲜有一个天真的解释：连月来的暴雨造成了全国上下的洪水和山地滑坡。
Whether the postponement is long-lasting depends on the interaction of economic events in China, the bilateral trade deficit and the evolution of U.S. unemployment.
是否这种延缓能够长期持续取决于中国经济项目的相互作用，双边贸易赤字以及美国失业率的进展。

ex: vt. 祈祷；恳求；央求
vi. 祈祷；请；恳求
n. (Pray)人名；(匈)普劳伊；(英)普雷
eg2: We pray you to show mercy.
我们恳求你发发慈悲。
We all pray for the victims of Japan.
我们都在为日本的受害者祈祷。
So, why not weigh in while I pray for my sins?
所以，当我为自己的罪孽祈祷的时候权衡下呢？

ex: vi. 团结；重整；恢复；（网球等）连续对打
vt. 团结；集合；恢复健康、力量等
n. 集会；回复；公路赛车会
n. (Rally)人名；(罗)拉利
eg2: He presided at the .
他主持了这个集会。
We should rally under the banner of socialism.
我们应当在社会主义的旗帜下团结起来。
We must rally the broad masses of the people round the Party.
我们必须将广大人民群众团结在党的周围。

ex: n. 漫步；漫游；随笔
vt. 漫步于…
vi. 漫步；漫游；闲逛；漫谈；蔓延

wp.La Ramble: 兰布拉大街;兰布拉大道

eg2: This is the best season for a  in the suburbs.
这是去郊区漫游的最好季节。
It relies on low-powered convection currents to ramble wherever it is easiest to drift to, and is then trapped by gentle, patient cul-de-sacs in the hills.
它依赖于弱势力的对流，而对流总是会闲逛到它最容易漂浮的地方，然后卡在温和耐心的小山丘这个死胡同里。
As I  on… I’m not explicitly referring to any one specific situation in this present moment. I just realize that Angel and I have so many objectives we desire to achieve.
当我再漫游的时候，我不会再当前的情况下体积任何特殊的情况，我只是知道，安吉尔和我有很多等着去实现的目标。

ex: n. 反政府的人；叛乱者；造反者；反抗权威者
v. 造反；反抗；背叛
adj. 造反的
网络 反叛；反叛者；叛逆者
eg2: rebel forces
叛乱武装
Armed rebels advanced towards the capital.
武装叛乱分子向首都推进。
I've always been the rebel of the family.
我在家里向来是个叛逆者。
He later rebelled against his strict religious upbringing.
他后来背叛了他所受的严格的宗教教育。
Most teenagers find something to rebel against.
大多数青少年都有反抗意识。

ex: vi. 变温和，变宽厚；减弱；缓和
vt. 使变温和；减轻
v. 再借给（relend的过去分词）
eg2: Only when Ms. Konstan visited him again and reminded him of how bad it might look -- and potential legal bills if things got out of hand -- did he finally .
直到康斯坦再度与他面谈，提醒他这个活动看上去会有多糟糕──如果情形失控的话还可能引发法律问题──他才最终平息下来。

ex: vt. 妨害；对…采取破坏行动
vi. 从事破坏活动
n. 破坏；破坏活动；怠工
eg2: Their apparent eagerness to  the talks reveals the dangers that progress poses for them.
他们显然渴望破坏谈判，这显示了进程给他们造成的威胁。
It’s relentless and, until you acknowledge it, it’s willing to sabotage all your attempts at peace.
它静不下来直到你肯承认，它很愿意以一种平和的方式破坏你的所有企图。
Life coaches are taught to be conscious of the power of negative self talk and how to get control over “the voices” so they won’t  our lives.
生活导师会意识到消极型自我对话所产生的力量，也知道如何去控制这些“声音”，这样它们就不会破坏我们的生活。

ex: adv. 平稳地，平滑地；流畅地，流利地
eg2: The pen writes .
这支钢笔书写流畅。
The train glides  into the station.
列车平稳而缓慢地驶进车站。
Don't jerk out your words,try to recite more .
不要结结巴巴地背诵，努力背得更流利些。

ex: n. 火花；电火花；火星；活力
v. 引发；触发；冒火花；飞火星
网络 斯巴达克；斯帕克；斯巴克
eg2: A shower of sparks flew up the chimney.
烟囱里飞出无数火星。
sparks from a faulty light switch
漏电的电灯开关发出的火花
A spark ignites the fuel in a car engine.
汽车发动机中的燃料由火花点燃。
a spark of hope
一线希望
As a writer he seemed to lack creative spark.
作为作家，他似乎缺少创作激情。
the sparks of revolution
革命的导火线
Sparks flew at the meeting(= there was a lot of argument) .
会上争论激烈，火星四溅。
The proposal would spark a storm of protest around the country.
这一提案将引发全国性的抗议浪潮。
Winds brought down power lines, sparking a fire.
大风刮断电线，引起了火灾。
The riots were sparked off by the arrest of a local leader.
骚乱是因逮捕一名当地领导人而触发的。
a sparking, crackling fire
噼啪直响、火星飞迸的火
The game suddenly sparked to life.
比赛突然变得激烈起来。

wp.SUCCESSOR TRUSTEE: 继任信托人;继承信托人

ex: n. 继承者；后续的事物

从前在遥远的东方，有一位皇帝，随着岁月的流逝，年事已高的他意识到该是找一个继任者的时候了。

ex: vt. 抑制；镇压；废止
eg2: They suppress the ingenuity of our people and businesses.
它们抑制我们的人民和企业的创造力。
This will suppress almost all diagnostics produced by the script.

ex: n. 嫌疑犯
adj. 可疑的；不可信的
